title: Telemedicine for Rural Bangladesh
author: Digital Health Initiative
summary: A comprehensive telemedicine platform connecting rural patients with specialist doctors, including AI-assisted diagnosis and medicine delivery integration.
problemStatement: Over 70% of Bangladesh's population lives in rural areas with limited access to quality healthcare. There is only 1 doctor per 2,000 people, and specialist care is concentrated in urban centers.
proposedSolution: Develop a telemedicine platform with video consultations, AI symptom checker, electronic prescriptions, and integration with local pharmacies for medicine delivery to rural areas.
technicalArchitecture: Mobile App: React Native for cross-platform

implementationPhases.description: Platform development and pilot in 2 upazilas
Expand to 20 upazilas with pharmacy integration

expectedImpact: Provide healthcare access to 50+ million rural citizens
Early detection of diseases through AI screening
